solution.text:
According to the pattern shown below,
\(1^3=1=1\)
\(2^3=3+5=8\)
\(3^3=7+9+11=27\)
.
.
\(_{j}_\) number of consecutive odd numbers will be needed to obtain the sum as \(_{j}_^3=_{{j**3}}_\)

content.text: How many consecutive odd numbers will be needed to obtain the sum as \(_{j}_^3=_{{j**3}}_\)?
